instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP5V_G3H: What is PP5V_G3H? PP5V_G3H is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a G3H mechanical off state.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Hi there,

I need your advice on troubleshooting the cause of failure The purpose is to get the data from the Macbook. The MacBook was very dusty. Here are the symptoms and measurements. 

Macbook On Battery / Without Batter Connection --> all 4 USB-C ports shows the same --> 5.15v 30 mAmps - just stable, no jumps. 

Removed the Board and it was dusty, cleaning with high-pressure air without damaging component but did not applies any isopropyl to check it under the microscope. While observing the board, saw that <CHIP>U5620</CHIP> has greenish corrosion on the right side of it. I see damage near pins 2 and 3 of <CHIP>U5620</CHIP>. 

Then I observed greenish corrosion on <RESISTOR>R9012</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R9010</RESISTOR>, and <CAPACITOR>C9002</CAPACITOR>. See the attached picture. Cleaned the area using Isopropyl alcohol. Please check the attached pictures.

Information about some Power Lines: 

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_T_USBC</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_TA_G3H_F</SIGNAL> - 5.1v
<SIGNAL>PPVBUS_USBC_TA</SIGNAL> - 0v - 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X</SIGNAL> - 0v (primary power for <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> missing) 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_3V3G3HRTC_X</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 0v (we need to check the Charger Chip - <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>)
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> - 5.1v
F7000 - 0v on <SIGNAL>PIN_1</SIGNAL>
F7001 - 0v on <SIGNAL>PIN_1</SIGNAL>

I am again lost. Now I removed the <CHIP>U5620</CHIP> and did measurements and waiting for your advice.  Thank you.

regards,
Zeyd

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Start checking diode mode to ground at L6960 and F7000.
If good, post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Diode Mode Testing for Shorts:

L6960 - No shorts
F7000 - No shorts

Basic Voltages on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 
<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> --> 5.1v
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> --> changes between 1.0v-1.2v / not stable
VDDA --> 5v
VDDP --> 5v
<SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL> --> 0v (nothing)
<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL> --> <SIGNAL>NC_CHGR_AUX_OK</SIGNAL> Could not find this signal on board schematiccs. is it possible something is not matching with the documentation?

Regards,
Zeyd

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
"L6960 - No shorts
F7000 - No shorts"
Can you post the readings?
Not only short means bad!
Post the readings on both ways; red probe, also black probe on ground (reverse way).
You may need to change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message: Just an update --> the chip  <CHIP>U5620</CHIP> is not soldered back to the board. I am not sure if it is damaged or not. Waiting for further advice on this. Thank you.

threads.message: Resolder <CHIP>U5620</CHIP> and its traces and related resistors.

threads.message:

Black probe on the ground and red probe on the side of elements.
L6960 --> 0.860v
F7000 --> 0.860v 

Thanks.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Normal way to check in diode mode, is RED probe on ground.
Reverse way (BLACK probe on ground) is rarely needed; but necessary in this case!
Now I'm not sure which readings did you post.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Sorry for making some mistakes. 

Diode Mode - Black Probe on the ground (Reverse way) :

L6960 --> 0.505v
F7000 --> 0.048v

Diode Mode - Red Probe on the ground:

L6960 --> 0.417v
F7000 --> 0.048v

Please check the above measurements. Thanks.

Regards,
Zeyd

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
0.048 is really bad value for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Check if you get the same value on a big coil.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
I did reverse and normal diode mode testing between ground and Test Point --> TPC5X7 (<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> main connection) --> I got 0.053v. Is this the correct point to make a test? basically, Multimeter cannot push enough volts from the ground to the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> coil. Am I getting it correctly? 

I also attached 2 pictures of diode mode testing using different Multimeters. Let me know what you think about this. 

[ATTACH type="full"]60475[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]60476[/ATTACH]

Thank you
Zeyd

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message: Check if you get similar reading on any big coil; like L7600/60, L9080, L7701, etc...

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message: Check in diode mode (ohm scale, or buzzer) between <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and any coil with similar reading; like L8102, LA850/60/70 and LA950.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Please see the measurements:

L8102 --> 52 Ohm
LA850 --> 65 Ohm
LA860 --> 27 Ohm (Multimeter Beeping Like Beep Beep Beep)
LA870 --> 27 Ohm (Multimeter Beeping Like Beep Beep Beep)
LA950 --> 0.079v - this is switching from Ohm to V

Regards,
Zeyd

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
If you checked correctly, then no high-side MOSFET shorted.
I hope last readings are taken between coils and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, not referred to ground.
In such case, you can try voltage injection method.
As is not pure short, a thermal IR cam can help you.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message: I did a mistake. Sorry for that. The last reading was taken between the ground (screw hole) and coils. I will check diode mode testing between <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and coils and post the results. Thank you.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Checked in diode mode with ohm scale --> Black Probe on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> point --> F7000:2 and red probe on big coils. Please see the details. I do not see a 1 Ohm measurement which is direct short. Please kindly advise. If voltage injection is required, please give me a bit more details or just show me where to read on your forum. Thanks. 

L8102 --> 67 Ohm
LA850 --> 70 Ohm
LA860 --> 67 Ohm 
LA870 --> 68 Ohm 
LA950 --> 65 Ohm

regards,
Zeyd

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Is better to do same check against all coils.
This avoid any problems, if you need to inject voltage into <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Are these readings between each above coils and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
In such case, is OK to inject voltage.

I understood you've checked on similar board.
But use diode mode and maintain same orientation for the probes.
Then you can compare the results.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message: I injected voltage into the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line and ground it to the screw hole. I started with 1v and it was using 400 mA. I increased the voltage to 2v and it was using 700 mA. Using IR cam, I saw that the area near <CHIP>U5620</CHIP> is getting warmer. I applied some Isopropyl alcohol to understand the exact chip. It is a <CHIP>U9580</CHIP> chip. I applied isopropyl several times and the <CHIP>U9580</CHIP> chip is getting dried very fast. So this should be out shortly. Now going forward what next steps?  I have not done anything yet. Should I remove that chip and check short again?

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Ooops, bad news.

"Check if you get similar reading on any big coil; like L7600/60, L9080, L7701, etc..."
I've just saw you didn't put L9580 in "etc"; check it now.

threads.message: L9580 - is 3 Ohm :( I missed it. Sorry.

threads.message: I should be start looking near to the shorted area. The lack of experience. Let me know what you think about the 3 Ohm on L9580. Thanks.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Some NAND chip got burnt.
Remove L9580/81 and check where the short remains.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU

threads.message: I removed both coils. then I chceked continuity between <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and L9581:1 (first pad), I receive 3 ohms again.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message: Now checked above listed coils against <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, the numbers are between 3-7 Ohms. All of them show short.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
<CHIP>U9580</CHIP> is burnt also; it cuased NAND damage.
I was expecting diode mode to ground reading on pad 2/L9580...

We have another recent thread about similar problem:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05-5v-0-00-0-01a-on-all-usb-c-ports.62231/page-2[/URL]

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message: diode mode to [B]ground[/B] reading on pad 2/L9580 and 2/L9581 is 132 Ohm on both pads.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Compare reading with L9080/81.
May have luck, doesn't look to be short.
Change <CHIP>U9580</CHIP> and check what happens.
Be sure all resistors and caps related with <CHIP>U9580</CHIP> are good, before applying power!

BTW, diode mode, doesn't show ohm value!

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Thank you very much. Please bear with me :). I know I made mistakes and this is frustrating. 

Diode Mode (Red Probe on ground) --> 2/L9580 and 2/L9581 is 0.111v. Please provide your comment about this as well.

Also "Be sure all resistors and caps related with <CHIP>U9580</CHIP> are good, before applying power!". Can I check the resistors and caps while they are on the board? or I should remove them. Thanks.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message: Just rechecked in diode mode using my Siglent Multimeter and the result between ground point and 2/L9580 is 0.1322v. Much more precise number. Thanks.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Don't worry about precision; NAND should be good on both channels.
Need to change <CHIP>U9580</CHIP> now.

Then you can also compare resistors value (in ohm), without removing from board.
Lucky enough to have two channels for comparison.

BTW, resistors with low ohm value will show almost same value.
High value resistors will show lower values than nominal, measured onboard.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message: I moved <CHIP>U9580</CHIP> and also tested resistors. Then connected charger cable over USB-C meter. Now we have 20v and 290mA on the charger. Amper usage is not moving up. It stays at 290 Ma and then drops to 0 and again to 290mA.  The normal boot process should use more power. Please advice. Thanks.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message: The SSDs on the side where we had a short are getting warm than other SSD on the opposite side.

threads.message: On one side it is getting hot immediately which potentially be another short. Please check the pictures. Thanks.

threads.message: Just checked the short between ground and big coils such as L7211 and L7221, the value is 2 Ohms which is direct short.

Do you have both <CHIP>U9080</CHIP>/580 placed on the board?

threads.message: On USB-C amper meter --> votlage is 20v. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.61v. After about 10 seconds it goes to 12.30v and then back to 12.61 stable.   <CHIP>U9080</CHIP>/580 placed on the board. Both chips there. Both chips are taken from the donor board.

threads.message:
I used a thermal camera to shoot what temperate pattern on board. So <CHIP>U9580</CHIP> is getting warm first then the SSD chip <CHIP>U9400</CHIP> is getting hot.  Check the picture below. there are 8 SSD chips on the board and only this one is getting hot all others are quiet cold. 

[ATTACH type="full"]60496[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
That chip may be bad.
Do you get the same diode mode reading on L9080/580 (to ground)?

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
Hi there. I checked the diode mode reading from L9080 to the ground and it is 0.3029v  and L9580 is  0.1275v. 

I also checked these readings on a donor board and both numbers on diode mode to ground L9080/L9580 is 0.4042v. Please advise. Thanks.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message:
You have to low reading on L9580.
At least one NAND chip got damaged; probably the one showed up on thermal camera.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 / No water Damage / Does not Boot / no DFU
threads.message: If one chip got damaged, not possible to get this board alive. Correct?
